data.title: Joseph P. Sullivan Obituary - Cambridge, Massachusetts
data.meta_description: Joseph P. Sullivan, of Newton, died at Saint Elizabeth’s Hospital in Brighton on, Sunday, July 20, 2008. Joseph grew up in Somerville and Jamaica Plain. A graduate of Jamaica Plain High School in 1932, he resided in FL after graduation, returning to MA to attend Tufts University. At Tufts he was a scholar athlete, playing football and lacrosse.  He 'captained' the lacrosse team during his senior year and was awarded membership on the 'All-New England Team' that year.  He graduated in 1938 and was also commissioned as a 2nd Lt. in the USMC(R).  He was called to active duty during WW II and participated in campaigns in Guadalcanal, Guam and Iwo Jima.  He was awarded the Bronze Star Medal in October of 1945 '...for meritorious service in connection with operations against the enemy while serving as Communications Officer for a Marine Regiment during the planning, training, assault and occupation phases of Guam, Marianas Islands from 19 February, 1944 to 1 April, 1945 and Commanding Officer of a Signal Company during the rehabilitation phase after the Iwo Jima campaign from 2 April to 3 September , 1945.'  He remained in the Reserves after the war and retired as a Colonel in October of 1959.  Employed by the Bell Telephone System for 32 years, he retired in 1977.  He was an avid sailor and a member of the Winthrop Yacht Club for many years.  He was a longtime parishioner at the Immaculate Conception Church in North Cambridge.  Joseph is survived by his beloved wife Isabel K. (Crimmings) Sullivan. His children, Joseph P. & his wife Barbara of Andover, Leslie S. Turner & her husband Robert of Newton, Denis & his wife Cynthia of Framingham, and Mary J. Sullivan of Blue Hill, ME, and seven grandchildren, Dana, Matthew, Ryan, Marc, Anna, Jesse and Emily. Relatives and friends are invited to attend a Memorial Mass in Saint Ignatius Church at the Boston College Campus in Newton on Wednesday, July 23rd, at 10 AM. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Alzheimer’s Association, 311 Arsenal St., Watertown, MA 02472. Arrangements by the Keefe Funeral Home, Arlington. For online condolences visit www.keefefuneralhome.com
